This is 51-year-old Kabba. He is married and has four children, aged 22, 19, 16 and 13. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him because she happens to be his wife. 

 In 1997, Kabba established his Muslim caps and beads business. He began his business just to equip him to adequately care for his family. His business is located at the city center, and his main customers are both men and women. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 300,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. 

Kabba has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy Muslim caps and beads. He hopes that this loan will help increase his stock level. In the future, Kabba plans to complete the construction of his house and to rent a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy Muslim caps and beads.

loans.name: Flor Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El comité  Flor de Pilar  se conformó en el año 2008 con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 9 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la de la Sr: Nancy quien se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, y mercería  esto gracias al  créditos que se le otorgaron en los ciclos, nos comenta que mediante los créditos  pudo mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
Solicita de este crédito nuevamente para poder utilizarlo en la compra de productos de limpieza y también de mercería, así tendrá mucha variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Pilar” committee was formed in 2008 through much effort.  It’s currently in its ninth cycle within the program.  Aside from their own businesses, the members also develop activities as a group.

Nancy’s story is a very good one.  She sells cleaning products, thanks to the loans she got in previous cycles.  She says that the loans helped her improve her business, quality of life, and income.

She is asking for a new loan in order to buy cleaning products and other merchandise.  In this way she can have a variety of items to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Yvoty Group

texts.es:
El comité  Yvoty   se conformó en fecha  06 de julio  del 2008  con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el 9 ciclo.
Una de las historias es la de la Sra. Daniela quien se dedica a la venta de productos  de mercería lo cual hace hacia el lado argentino. Ella es una persona que desde siempre ha luchado por salir adelante y dar todo a su familia, y quiere poder seguir haciéndolo, es por eso que pide de este crédito, el cual quiere invertir en la compra de artículos de mercería y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The Yvoty committee was formed on July 6, 2008, through great effort.  It’s currently in its ninth cycle.

Daniela’s story is that she sells haberdashery items on the Argentinian side.  She has always worked hard to get ahead and provide her family with everything they need.  She wants to be able to continue doing it.  She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise so that she can provide her customers the variety to which they are accustomed.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Nyakisi Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Elisha is a 34-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a drug shop where he has spent five years (since 2008) working for at least 10 hours a day. He serves the rural community in his village which has greatly helped the people from covering longer distances for drugs. He is also a farmer and that is where he accumulated capital for this business. He faces challenges of inadequate capital and customers not paying on time. He has personal goals of educating his children and building a permanent house for his family. He is a member of the above mentioned group where every member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. Elisha is requesting for a loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah used the previous loan to buy sugar, soap, salt, and cooking oil to sell. She is a 26-year-old woman, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Her desire is to have a big family business. She has a retail shop which is very feasible although with a challenge of limited capital due to ever increasing demand. Nevertheless, Sarah has been able to reap profits and wants to be a wholesale trader. She intends to invest the loan in purchasing sugar, rice, soap, salt and juice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, soap, salt and juice to sell.

loans.name: Wendy Lorena

texts.es: Wendy, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula. Ella tiene un año de haber iniciado la venta de mercadería como ser blusas, jeans, ropa interior, calcetas y pantalones. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Este negocio lo emprendió con sus propios ahorros que obtuvo del trabajo anterior. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir más el negocio y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes de entrega. Su meta es establecer el negocio fijo en su casa, y presentar el producto en vitrinas y estantes. Agradece a ODEF y a Kiva la oportunidad brindada por el préstamo.
texts.en:
Wendy is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.

A year ago Wendy began selling merchandise such as blouses, jeans, undergarments, socks, and trousers. She conducts her sales as a street vendor and by taking orders. Wendy established this business with her own savings that she acquired from her previous job. The loan she is requesting is for 10,000 HNL and will be used to restock her business. This will enable her to complete the outstanding orders that she has to deliver.

Her goal is to establish a permanent business in her house and to present her products with display cabinets and shelving. She is grateful to ODEF and Kiva for the opportunity that has been provided through this loan.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Assita B

texts.fr:
Née en Février 1983  à Sikasso, Madame Assita B.  est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Assita B. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités de vente des articles divers tels que les bonbons, les allumetes, les biscuits,  les savons, sachets de lait en poudre, etc. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’integrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a environ deux ans. 
Après quatre prêts individuesl tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Ce cinquième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 cartons de savons, 4 cartons d’allumetes, 5 paquets de biscuits, 2 cartons de bonbon  sur place à Sikasso qui seront vendus de façon ambulante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in February 1983 in Sikasso, Ms. Assita B. is a married mother of two children living with her husband and their children in a traditional large extended family in Bougoula Ville, Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
After having tried many activities without success, Assita B. began selling various items such as sweets, matches, biscuits, soaps, packets of powdered milk, etc.
With the goal of better satisfying her increasingly growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago.
After four individual loans, all repaid properly, she is on her fifth individual loan.
This fifth loan will allow her to buy ten boxes of soap, four boxes of matches, five packets of biscuits, and two boxes of sweets in the area in Sikasso, and these goods will be sold door-to-door.
With this loan, she foresees realizing a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which will be used to increase her contribution to the household expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John, aged 33, is a married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer and also trades in coffee. With the proceeds, he has been able to start a poultry project. He dreams of educating his children up to the University, building a permanent house and buying a car or motorcycle to help him in transportation of goods from one market to the other. John intends to use the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en Juin 1976 à Sikasso, Fatoumata est une veuve et mère de deux enfants qui vit chez son oncle avec un de ses enfants à Bougoula-Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Fatoumata mène une activité d’achat et de vente de condiments il y’a environ cinq années au grand marché de Sikasso où elle dispose d’une place. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décida d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est est à son troisième prêt individuel et les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce troisième prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son stock de condiments avec 10 cartons de cube maggie, 10 cartons concentrée de tomate, 5 sacs d’oignons, 10 cartons de moutarde, 2 sacs d’oignons. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Sikasso et effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes de femmes. 
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in June 1976 in Sikasso, Fatoumata is a widowed mother of two children living at her uncle's house with one of her children in Bougoula Ville, in downtown Sikasso.
Fatoumata has run a business buying and selling condiments for about five years at the grand market in Sikasso, where she has a stall.
With the goal of better satisfying her increasingly growing clientele, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her third individual loan. The previous loans were repaid properly.
This third loan will allow her to augment her stock of condiments with ten boxes of Maggi cubes, ten boxes of tomato concentrate, seven bags of onions, and ten boxes of mustard. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Sikasso and makes her sales at retail, in cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising men and women.
With this loan, she foresees realizing a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to contribute to the household expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children; none of them attend school. She does not look after any other family members.

She has been selling banana leaves and pumpkin from the market at retail prices for 10 years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bundles of banana leaves for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to be able to start selling wholesale.  

She joined MCDT because of the timely loans. She lives in her house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include transport.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of banana leaves and pumpkins.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 31-year-old married man with two children, aged 6 and 4, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He sells motorcycle spare parts as well as repairing motorcycles. He is a very honest man working in a trading center, and he has rendered good services to his customers. 

In the future, he wants to expand his business and educate his children. John is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 30-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been trading in agricultural produce for three years. He started by carrying out farming, basically maize, beans and Irish potatoes, on a commercial basis. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the demand for his customers.

He has personal goals of buying a motorcycle to ease transport and educating his children, as well as a business goal of expanding his business into new markets. Peter intends to use the loan to buy agricultural produce, such as maize and beans, to sell.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce, such as maize and beans, to sell.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Agé de 28 ans, Souleymane est célibataire sans enfant, domicilié  à Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Il dispose d’une quincaillerie, en plus, il est grossiste d’huile, utilisé pour la fabrication du savon. Il trouve que son  activité est beaucoup rentable, sa demande est souvent très grande. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Monsieur a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs.  IL est à son  1er prêt  individuel. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises : ampoules, fil électrique, peinture, serrures et colles. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et de Bamako et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala KoKo à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Souleymane compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Souleymane is 28 years old, unmarried without children, and lives in Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso).
He owns a hardware store and is also a wholesaler selling oil, which is used to make soap. He finds that his business is very profitable, and demand is often very high. In order to satisfy his customers and expand his business, Mr. Souleymane turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet his objectives. He is on his first individual loan. This loan will be used to acquire stocks of various merchandise: bulbs, electric wire, paint, locks, and glue. He gets his supplies from the wholesalers in Koutiala and Bamako and makes his sales at his shop in Koutiala Koko to a diverse clientele. With this loan, Souleymane intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which he will use to repay his loan, provide for himself, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy hardware supplies.

loans.name: Omaro

texts.fr:
Agé de 31 ans, marié et père d’un enfant, Omaro vit avec ses parents  dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Il n’a pas eu la chance de faire les études, raison pour laquelle il a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus il y’a plus de 7 ans.  Il est très bien sollicité car de nos jours les téléphones portables sont devenus indispensables. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle, Omaro a fait recours à   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y’a  3 ans, il est a son 3ème  prêt individuel  et les deux précédents ont été bien remboursés.  
Avec ce financement  il compte acheter 15 téléphones portables et des accessoires à Bamako, il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque à une clientèle mixte en espèce. Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans les jours à venir, il envisage d’agrandir son activité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
Omaro is 31 years old, married with one child, and lives with his parents in the city of Koutiala (in the region of Sikasso). He did not have the chance to attend school, which is why he has been involved in income-generating activities for over seven years. He is highly sought-after, since mobile phones have become indispensable these days. In order to satisfy his cilentele, Omaro turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. He is on his third individual loan, and the two previous ones were repaid properly.
With this loan, he intends to buy 15 mobile phones and accessories in Bamako. He makes his sales at his kiosk to a diverse clientele. With this loan, he intends to earn a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which he will use to provide for himself and invest in his business.
In the coming days, he foresees expanding his business to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Ina

texts.en:
This is thirty-two-year-old Ina. She is married, and has two children ages eleven and four. She has two additional dependents that live with her and go to school. 

In 2000, Ina established her drinks and provision business. She began the business following her husband's retirement six years ago because it was not easy to maintain their home. She worked assisting friends until she gathered enough capital to open her own business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL4, 000,000 in order to buy 100 crates of soft drinks. She will use the remainder of the loan to transport the drinks to the shop. 
She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 1,000,000. In the future, Ina plans to become one of the strongest distributors of soft drinks by the grace of God and with the support of KIVA through ARD. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 100 crates of soft drinks and transport them to her shop.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Oumou est née en 1964 à Bamako, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit  avec son mari, sa coépouse et  leurs enfants dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Oumou n’as pas eu la chance de continuer les études,  raison pour laquelle elle s’est intéressée au commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités de revenus, actuellement elle opte pour la vente de diverses marchandises telles : les habits, les chaussures, savons etc. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’élargir son activité, Oumou  a fait recours  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plusieurs années. Elle a pris 3 prêts dans l’association (prêt solidaire) tous remboursés correctement  et elle est à son 2e prêt  individuel. Avec ce financement, elle compte acheter des habits, des sacs des savons et des colliers auprès des grossistes. Elle effectue sa vente en ambulant et à la porte de sa maison à une clientèle mixte  au comptant et souvent à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour le  remboursement des intérêts de Soro et contribuer à l’amélioration de la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumou was born in 1964 in Bamako, and is a married mother of four children. She lives with her husband, his other wife, and their children in the city of Koutiala.
Oumou did not have the chance to continue her studies, which is why she has been interested in business for over ten years. After having run several income-generating activities, she currently chooses to sell various items such as clothing, shoes, soaps, etc. To increase her working capital in order to enlarge her business, Oumou turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso several years ago. She obtained three association (group/solidarity) loans, all of which were repaid properly. She is on her second individual loan. With this loan, she intends to buy clothing, bags of soap, and necklaces from the wholesalers. She makes her sales door-to-door and at the door of her house to a diverse clientele, in cash and often on credit.
She foresees realizing a monthly profit of 90,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the interest on the Soro Loan, and also continue to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: Esther 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the group coordinator of Esther 1, 3, & 4, which is made up of 15 micro-entrepreneurs. This group is located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. Margarita enjoys working and being at her home with her family. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children. She said that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business. She dreams of having a successful business and to bring change to her family.

Margarita operates a business selling miscellaneous items like cosmetics, shoes, and clothes. She will use the loan to purchase dozens of these items to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her 13th loan with Esperanza International, as with each loan she has been able to invest in her business and improve it, making it possible to provide for her family's needs. She thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products like clothes, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 31 year-old hard working married man with 3 children aged 3, 5 and 7. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and he acquired his start-up capital from phone charging and farming. Like all farmers he faces challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand, so his business plan is to own a wholesale shop. Vincent intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt and cooking oil for the retail shop

loans.name: Jetrida

texts.en: Jetrida is a fifty-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She has been trading in cassava flour for thirteen years and works eleven hours a day.  She got her start up capital from farming which she still practices. She hopes to expand business and educate her children despite the lack of enough adequate capital. Jetrida intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for resell.

loans.name: Fideri

texts.en: Fideri is a thirty-one-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the agriculture business for ten years and works twelve hours a day.  He also pigs and goats for additional income. He dreams of expanding his farm despite challenges of unpredictable weather changes. Fideri intends to use the loan to pay workers who are ploughing his garden for growing tomatoes.

loans.use: to pay workers who are ploughing his garden to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for fourteen years and works eleven hours a day at her stall located on a busy street.  She also farms for additional income. She hopes to expand her business, educate her children and buy land despite challenges of stiff competition and lack of enough capital. Agnes intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en: Njira is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for three year.  His love of helping and nurturing young people inspired him into service and he has no regrets. He dreams of educating his children up to the university level and venture into farming. Njira intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a twenty-five-year-old married woman with one child and six dependents living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and is six months into the service of teaching. She is challenged by the long distance from her home to the school and her dream is to set up a business to help meet the daily transport costs and other family expenses. The purpose of the loan is to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a forty-nine-year-old man with 12 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a farmer and specifically, he grows cocoa.  He also has a retail shop. His personal goal is to educate his children up to the university level while his business plan is a wholesale shop and buying more land for cocoa growing. Tom is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Kyerima Tutungukye Group

texts.en: Yudita is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. She is a farmer and also sells fish for a living. Yudita is serving very many customers and they value her as a strong lady. She has a dream of starting a retail shop to increase her income and educate her children so they are able to attain degrees as at a minimum. Yudita intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Nyakakindo Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Wilson is a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan. He is a farmer and also sells second hand clothes to meet the needs of his family. He is a good father and he desires to educate his children up to the university level. Unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation hinder his business while his dream is to venture into mechanized agriculture. Wilson intends to use the loan to buy onions for planting.

loans.use: to buy onions for planting.

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en: Mr.Anhbayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and 3 children in a small house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife Batchuluun works at local market as a clothes retailer. His daughter Sunjid, age 4 goes to the local kindergarten and daughter Ariunzaya, age 6 and son Myangantsooj, age 8 go to the local school. Anhbayar used to be herder and his family moved to the province center and he is starting his own taxi service. He is now requesting 3'150'000MNT to purchase an eco-friendly hybrid (electric and gas) car to start his taxi service in town. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase an co-friendly hybrid car to start his taxi service in town.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is 52-year-old Margaret. She is married, and has four children aged 19, 15, 13 and 9 years old. In 1996, Margaret established her provisions (such as sugar, milk, sardines, margarine, etc.) and drinks business. She began her business because she needed a source of income to help her husband provide a livelihood for her family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,400,000SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Margaret has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stocks of provisions and drinks. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 500,000. In the future, Margaret plans to expand to the sale of building materials, and to take care of her family and uplift the standard of living of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions such as sugar, milk, sardines, margarine, etc., and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, shorts and caps for his business.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a shop window and foods such as pork and bread. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a shop window and foods such as pork and bread.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of shoes to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of  shoes to sell.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Suong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products to sell such as food and beverages.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi would like to take a further loan to buy more incense and religious articles to stock her store. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of products such as incense, incense burners, and worship-related items.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, 47, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker. She earns an income making and selling cakes in front of her house. 

She started this business seventeen years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a large quantity of good-quality ingredients to make cakes, which will enable her to increase her sales and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a driver for hire. For eight years, she has supported her family by making plastic laminated items for people in her community.

Phung would like a loan to purchase a laminating machine to provide better quality products at competitive prices. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy a laminating machine.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is a 35-year-old married woman. She lives with two daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For five years, she and her husband have run a business supplying drinking water for sale to people in her community.

Hang would like a loan to purchase water tanks to increase her sales. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy drinking water tanks.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 45 years old and is married. She has a son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as an electrical maintenance worker for a hotel. 

She has run a business selling drinking water tanks, beverages and coffee from her house for three years. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of beverages and coffee to sell to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy beverages and coffee.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 45, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a storekeeper. Thao started a grocery store five years ago. She sells soft drinks and cosmetic products. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of soft drinks, coffee and good quality cosmetic products to sell at her store to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of soft drinks, coffee and good quality cosmetic products.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. 

His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater quantity and range of basic products to sell from his general store.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is 40 years old, and is married with two children. Her husband has been running a business of garbage collection. She has been running a shop, sewing and selling traditional dresses in front of her door for ten years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hang is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more fabric and better quality sewing materials so that she will be able to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and better quality sewing materials.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam is requesting a new loan to buy more varieties of rice to sell. Nam's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more varieties of rice to sell.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is requesting a new loan to buy dressmaking materials to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy dressmaking materials.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy fabric and materials such as needles and threads. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials such as needles and threads.

loans.name: Vu

texts.en:
Vu is 36 years old and is married. He has three children and lives with them and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City.

He has run a motorcycle repair shop at his house for 10 years. He intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of motorcycle parts and tires to sell from his shop.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of motorcycle parts and tires to sell.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is requesting a new loan to buy better quality clothes at competitive prices from wholesalers. Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase better quality clothes at competitive prices from wholesalers.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 53, is widowed and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income by running a jewelry shop that sells bracelets and necklaces. 

She started this activity five years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of jewelry products to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of jewelry products to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan is 48 years old and is married with two children. Her husband earns money by working as a gardener. Xuan has been running a store selling building materials for three years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Xuan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products for building such as paint and bathroom items. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products for building such as paint and bathroom items.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of goods in bulk to stock her general store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 57 years old and is married with four children, two sons and two daughters. She and her husband have been running a business producing candles for eight years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more materials and equipment to increase her production of candles. She hopes that this will enable her to supply more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to produce candles.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Thao's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools to make school bags.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 43 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a painter for hire. Thuy runs a food stall and also sells clothes. 

She started her business fifteen years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying food and ingredients to make meals to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and ingredients to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Tien

texts.en:
Tien is 59 years old and is married. She has a son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband have run a business making plastic laminated items in their house for eight years. She intends to use her loan to buy plastic materials for her business.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her family's emergencies.

loans.use: To buy plastic materials to use for laminating.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo, 58, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business thirty years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 48 years old, has a daughter and is divorced. She has been running a food stall in front of her door for 22 years. She started this business to cover her expenses, and raise her daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food and many kind of soft drinks to sell from her stall. She hopes that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food and many kinds of soft drinks to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with three children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a security guard. For nine years, she has run a food stall selling meals to people in her community.

Thuy would like a loan to purchase better quality food and ingredients to make different meals to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase better quality food and ingredients to make meals to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 50 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has run a general store from her house for 12 years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and she intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 22, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a deliverer. Loan started a cafe two years ago. She sells coffee and beverages. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of beverages and coffee to sell in her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of beverages and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van, 39, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a teacher.

Van has been running a general store and selling sugar-cane juice in front of her house for thirteen years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of basic goods to stock her general store and a greater quantity of sugar-cane to increase her production of sugar-cane juice. She hopes that this will enable her to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy basic goods and sugar-cane to sell from her general store.

loans.name: Bajame

texts.en:
Bajame is in her fifties. She is an Egyptian, devoted to her faith and a married mother of a grown-up child.
 
Unlike many people from her community who live in the suburbs, she actually lives in a village, and loves to plant potatoes and onions and sell the products. The south central region where she resides is known for the best potatoes and onions as well. People in the village said “Bajame is a lovely lady; always happy and loving and a hard-worker. All of us here love her and have deep respect for her.” 

She needs a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek to purchase planting seeds and hopes that Kiva lenders will support her financially. Meantime, she wants to express her gratitude to VisionFund Albania for reaching out to her and the kind-hearted Kiva lenders for helping out vulnerable people like herself.

loans.use: To purchase potato and onion seeds to plant.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 49, is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Anh started a business selling wire screens 18 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of materials to make screens to sell to her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy materials to make screens to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan is 35 years old and is single. Nhan has been running a beauty salon from his house for eight years. He started this business to cover his expenses. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nhan is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a hair drying/setting machine to better meet his customers' demands. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities, and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a hair drying /setting machine.

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
Ce  mécanicien de profession  est également revendeur de pièces détachées motos,  il est âgé de  33 ans,  marié  avec une épouse, père de 5 enfants et vit chez son père avec sa famille dans la préfecture de Koutiala   (Région de Sikasso).  
Du à des raisons sociales, il n’a pas pu continuer les études primaires raisons pour laquelle il s’est accroché à la mécanique, qu’il appris  auprès de son frère il y’a 10 ans. Cette activité très rentable lui procure assez de revenus car il reçoit beaucoup de commandes par  mois.  Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’élargissement de son activité,  Mahamadou a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs . Il est à  son 2ème prêt  individuel.  Ce prêt servira a acquérir des pièces de rechanges motos en provenance de Bamako. Il effectue son activité de vente dans son garage dans la ville de Koutiala, à une clientèle mixte au comptant et à crédit. 
Mahamadou compte réaliser un  bénéfice de 100 000 FCFA par mois, qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts, subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
This mechanic is also a motorbike spare parts salesman, he is 33 years old and married. He and his wife live with their five children with his father in the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region).
For social reasons he was not able to finish his primary school studies, this is why he went into mechanics, a profession that he learned from his brother ten years ago. This profitable activity makes sufficient income for him as he receives many orders every month. In order to satisfy his clientele and enlarge his business, Mahamadou requests a loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution hoping to reach his goals. This is his second individual loan. This loan will enable him to purchase spare parts for motorcycles from Bamako. He runs his sales business in his garage in Koutiala to a mixed clientele for cash or for credit.
Mahamadou hopes to make a profit of 100 000 FCFA per month which he will use to repay the interests of his loan, to cover his needs and invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorbikes.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza tiene 54 años de edad, tiene  hijos mayores de edad e independientes que la ayudan a poder mantenerse. La señora Lorenza es comerciante desde hace varios años, tiene una despensa en donde vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, su local es propio y está en su casa. Tiene mucha clientela ya que es una zona bastante concurrida por los clientes porque queda sobre una calle principal. Gracias a esta actividad ella han podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, panificados, lácteos y demás y así seguir vendiendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 54, has independent, adult children who help her out when necessary.  She has worked as a merchant for several years and owns a store where she sells all types of basic needs items.  The business is set up in her house and she has many customers because her location is near the main street.  Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead, maintain her household and cover any unexpected expense.

She is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as beverages, baked goods, dairy products and other items so she can continue selling quality merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: To buy beverages, baked goods, dairy products and other items.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol, de 40 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Miguel y sus 3 hijos: Rosario, Graciela y Lucero a las que cuida en la casa que compró hace 16 años.  El trabajo al que se dedica todos los días es la preparación de comida en el restaurante que abrió al frente de un colegio, le va muy bien en el negocio pues hay mucho movimiento, además se encuentra realizando una obra de construcción por lo que tiene mucha clientela, su trabajo comienza desde los primeros rayos de sol hasta el atardecer. Ahora desea invertir al máximo en los insumos pues tiene mucha clientela y los alimentos se terminan con facilidad, por lo que desea comprar al por mayor. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo obtenido, pues de esa manera se siente tranquila de invertir, además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que en su asociación le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Marisol, invertirá el dinero en la compra de insumos para la preparación e sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Marisol, age 40, is a simple woman. She lives with her husband Miguel and their three children: Rosario, Graciela, and Lucero. Marisol cares for her children in the house that they purchased 16 years ago. The work she performs every day involves preparing food at the restaurant that she opened in front of a school. Her business is doing very well since there is a lot of traffic. She also built a structure since she has many customers. Marisol begins her work when the first rays of sunlight appear and continues until sunset. Now she wants to invest the most in supplies because she has many customers and wants to finish preparing dishes more easily. This is her reason for buying in bulk.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is grateful for the support she has obtained. As a result, she can invest with peace of mind. Marisol also promises to be punctual with her payments since her Communal Bank has taught her how to be responsible. She will invest the money in the purchase of supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
There are not many grocery stores in the town of Fort Hancock, Texas, but Maria owns and operates one of them. It serves a population of 3,476, many of whom must make an hour drive into El Paso for their groceries if they can’t buy locally.

Taking after her mother, who brought Maria and the rest of her family to the United States for greater opportunities and to serve more customers, Maria decided to open her business, A. Grocery.

Within her store, Maria sells food, beer and other grocery items at low prices, she says. 

Maria has been in business for more than a decade and has created five jobs. She says her most popular item is the beer. She sells approximately 1,000 cans weekly. 

Seeing that Maria and her husband did not have enough funds to keep up with the store’s demand and costs to repair their larger refrigerator, they decided to turn to Accion Texas Inc. for assistance. 

She says the loan was enormously beneficial to her. Now, when customers decide to shop at her store, she will have exactly what they need – and a perfectly running fridge to store plenty more.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory and repair their larger refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory and fixtures to showcase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment such as tables, chairs and tablecloths.

loans.name: Kristi

texts.en:
After six years of counseling the homeless, Kristi learned that the No. 1 factor leading to homelessness is mental illness. So with her education in psychology, she opened her business to aid them.

Her practice with the homeless ended in October, 2012, when Kristi decided to work with families who have members with psychotic disorders. She also transitioned to offer a flexible schedule allowing weekend and evening meetings.

Kristi describes her practice as a small one with a handful of clients whom she helps rid themselves from their psychotic symptoms, become more sociable and simply have a regular life.

Encouraged by the Small Business Administration in Shreveport, Kristi applied for a loan with Accion Texas Inc., which she used to furnish her new office. In the past, Kristi worked out of her home, but she says an extra office made it easier to concentrate, since she is no longer distracted by her two children, who are 8 and 2 years of age. She also purchased educational curriculum to study more on psychotic disorders.

Without the assistance of an Accion loan, Kristi says she wouldn’t have been able to help as many people as she does now. She used to see four patients but is now able to see 10, more than doubling her services.

loans.use: to furnish her new office.

loans.name: Diem

texts.en:
Diem, 39 years old, is married and has one daughter. Her husband is a worker in a nearby company. Diem supports her family with the income she earns from a business selling girdle cakes. She began this business three years ago. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Diem intends to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and higher quality of ingredients to make her cakes. She hopes that this will better meet her customers' demands and will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and higher quality of ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is 40 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver. She runs a food stall to earn a living and raise her children. She started her business 16 years ago. She intends to take out a loan to expand her business by buying good quality food and ingredients to make food to sell to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality ingredients to make food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh, 47, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a mason. Hanh supports her family by running a food stall in front of her house, which she has done for twenty years. She is requesting a loan to buy good quality ingredients to make food, ready-made food and beverages to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to help her improve her family's living conditions and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy good quality ingredients to make food, ready-made food and beverages to sell from her stall

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is requesting a new loan to buy thread and material for her weaving business. Anh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy thread and materials for weaving

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 42-year-old married woman. She lives with three children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a carpenter. For 30 years, she has run a business of selling water morning glory.

Thuy would like a loan to purchase water morning glory to resell and rent land to grow vegetables. She hopes this will enable her to increase her income and diversify the products that she sells. She also hopes that she will be able to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To purchase water morning glory to resell and to rent land to grow vegetables

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 38 years old and is married. He has three children and lives with them in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns money by running an internet shop at his house, which he has done for 5 years. He intends to use his loan to repair and upgrade his computer system.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for emergencies cases.

loans.use: To repair and upgrade his computer system

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao, 54, is widowed and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She has started a beauty shop and a general store. Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products such as shampoos and hairdressing tools to better satisfy her customers during the coming Tet holiday season. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products such as shampoos and hairdressing tools

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en:
Duyen is 62 years old and divorced. She has been running a business of weaving fabric for 36 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Duyen is requesting a loan to buy silk threads for producing fabric. This investment will enable her to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business and have money to reinvest in it in the future.

loans.use: To buy silk threads for producing fabric

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 36 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is a driver. Hue has been running a beauty shop in front of her door for eight years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hue is requesting a loan to expand her business. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity of materials to increase his production of shoes to better satisfy his customers. 

Sang's previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. 

He also hopes that, through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of materials to increase his production of shoes

loans.name: Sau

texts.en: Sau is requesting a new loan to buy and process waste fabric materials for recycling and sale. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity, and sales. She hopes that her new loan will help her increase the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and process waste fabric materials for recycling and sale

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Nhung is a 56-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has six children. Nhung and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for seven years. Nhung would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that with the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh, 40, is married and has one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income through running a general store in front of their house. 

Dinh started this business seven years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store, better satisfy her customers and expand her business.

She hopes her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is an assistant driver. For the past four years, Dung has supported her family by running a general store in the front of her house. Dung would like to get a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of confectionery and foods such as fish sauces and household items to sell in her store to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that she will be able to increase her income and set aside some savings through the loan.

loans.use: to buy greater variety and quantity of confectionery and foods such as fish sauces and household items to sell.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en: Cuong is a 25-year-old single man. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City. To support his family, Cuong earns an income by selling rice. He started this business two years ago. He would like to take out a loan to expand his current business. With the loan, he will buy more kinds of rice of higher quality that will enable him to attract additional customers. Cuong hopes that, with this loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of rice of higher quality to sell

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
Muoi, 52, is married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business seven years ago. She sells many kinds of confectionery and personal use items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

Muoi hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Oanh's previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of food and beverages to sell at her store.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai would like to take a further loan to buy more food and ingredients to make dishes to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family.

She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and ingredients to make dishes for selling at her stall.

loans.name: Isman

texts.ru: Исман родился в городе ОШ (южная часть Кыргызстана) в простой семье фермера. Окончил школу и получил профессию метеоролога. Исман отец 6 детей – 3 сыновей и 3 дочек. Четверо из 6 детей взрослые и занимаются разными делами. 2  Детей школьники. В 199 году, семья Исмана решает  завести хозяйство, таким образом положив начало бизнесу в разведении скота. Полная отдача сил и неустанный труд помогли Исману развить свой бизнес, доходы от которого в сумме около 8,000 сом (KGS)ежемесячно позволили обучать детей и оплачивать ежедневные затраты семьи.  В данное время с ней проживает ее младший дети, они вместе с матерью помогает отцу по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Исмана имеется 54 голов МРС. В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Исман обратился в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Исман мечтает со временем женить сына и помочь ему построить дом. В будущем хочет обучить младших детей в университетах.
texts.en:
Isman was born to a simple family of farmers in the city of Osh. He completed school and became a meteorologist. Isman has six children - three sons and three daughters. Four of his six children are grown and work in various fields, while two of his children are still in school. 

In 1999, Isman's family decided to start a farm. Thus, they began breeding cattle. Hard work and tireless effort helped Isman develop his business. His 8,000 som monthly profit from the business allowed him to educate his children and pay for his family's daily expenses. 

Isman's youngest children are currently living with him. Together with their mother, his children help him with the farm. Today Isman owns 54 heads of sheep and goats. 

With the goal of increasing his overall head of sheep and goats, Isman turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a 100,000 som loan. Isman dreams of one day marrying his son and helping him build a home. In the future, he would like to give his youngest children a university education.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Rafoatkhon

texts.ru: Рафоатхон жительница города Исфары. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем, имеет двух детей. Муж Рафоатхон работает таксистом. Сама Рафоатхон уже 10 лет занимается торговлей. В переднем дворе своего дома у нее есть магазин, где она продает продукты питания. В ведении бизнеса ей помогает семья. С целью увеличения товарооборота Рафоатхон обратилась за кредитом. Полученные деньги она использует для покупки продуктов питания, и тем самым увеличить ассортимент продуктов в магазине.
texts.en:
Rafoatkhon is a 39-year-old resident of Isfara. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver, while she has worked in sales for ten years. Rafoatkhon sells food products out of her own store, located in her front yard. 

With the goal of increasing her assortment of goods, Rafoatkhon turned to a loan. She plans to use the loan money to purchase food products, which will increase the overall assortment in her store.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and personal use items, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. 

Linh’s previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and personal use items.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Esanboi

texts.ru:
Эсанбой мужчина в возрасте 45 лет.  Он женат и имеет на воспитании четверых детей.   Эсанбой  очень трудолюбивый  человек и хороший семьянин.  
Он занимается  сельскохозяйственной продукции  около 20 лет.  Выращивает репку и редьку.   Также дома вместе с семьей откармливает и перепродает скот. Покупает скот на рынке и откормив через некоторое время продает на том же рынке. Доход у него больше от откорма скота чем от сельхоз. продукции. Но Эсанбой старается и выращивать овощи и откармливать скот, так как очень нуждается в денежных средствах.
 На полученный кредит Эсанбой планирует купить скот и корм для скота. Он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить свой бизнес. Эсанбой благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Esanboi is a 45-year-old married man with four children. He is a very hardworking person and a good family man. 

Esanboi has worked in agricultural production for almost 20 years. He grows turnips and radishes. Additionally, he and his family fatten and sell livestock. Esanboi purchases the livestock at the market, fattens them over time, and then resells them at the same market. His income from livestock fattening is larger than from agricultural production, but he tries to both grow vegetables and fatten livestock because he is in real need of money. 

Esanboi plans to use his loan to purchase both livestock and feed. He would like to increase his overall head of livestock and expand his business. He thanks Kiva for the financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha would like to take a further loan to buy fabrics, which she will use to make clothes to sell at her store. Ha's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for making clothes, which she will sell in her own store.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van is 42 years old and is married. She has two children, and she lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Van and her husband have run a business of making shoes at their house for over one year. She intends to use her loan to buy materials and good quality tools, to increase their production of shoes.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions. In addition, she hopes to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools to produce more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is 32 years old and is married. She has a daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer. Thao has been running a general store in front of her door for two years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income with which to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items, and many kinds of soft drinks, to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her inventory. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest into her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items, and many kinds of soft drinks, to stock her store

loans.name: Ba

texts.en:
Ba is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Ba hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Ba

texts.en:
Ba would like to take a further loan to buy more furniture and beverages to stock her store. Ba's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

Ba hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more furniture and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: José  es cliente Kiva él está muy agradecido con su primer préstamo ya que le ayudo a invertir en su siembra y obtener mejores ingresos,  porque pudo comprar los bueyes que necesitaba  para arar la tierra para poder sembrar sus granos  básicos. Es por esta razón que él está requiriendo de su segundo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz y frijoles, ya que con las ganancias que le genere su siembra  podrá obtener un mejor rendimiento de su cosecha para vender a un buen precio y obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en: José is a Kiva client and he is very thankful for his first loan because it helped him to invest in the sowing of his land and to earn more money. The loan allowed him to purchase the oxen that he needed to plow his land and he was also able to plant basic grains. Because of this, he is in need of a second loan in order to invest in the purchase of corn and beans. With the earnings that he generates from the harvest, he will be able to get a better yield from his harvest that he will be able to sell at a good price and obtain more earnings. His future plans are to improve the infrastructure of his house.

loans.use: purchase corn and beans.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yaya est un célibataire de 25 ans, qui vit chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers périphériques de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yaya  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,s’est initié à la fabrique des savons traditionnels (savons noirs) il y’a environ six années qu’il a appris auprès de sa mère. Il mène son activité dans son domicile où il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
