Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel.
Il compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt, 8 futs des déchets d’huile de coton (pâtes noires), 6 sacs de soude caustique et 3 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe. Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, il les revend en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya is 25 years old, unmarried, and lives with his father in a large traditional household in Sanoubougou I, one of the surrounding areas of the city of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Having tried numerous activities without success, Mr. Yaya started making traditional soaps (black soaps) about six years ago - he learned this trade from his mother. He runs his business at home, where he is highly sought-after by his clientele due to the quality of his products. To satisfy his increasingly growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom he is on his second individual loan.
With this new loan, he intends to buy eight barrels of used cotton oil (black mix), six bags of lye, and three cartloads of firewood. After making the soap with a base of used cotton oil and lye, he sells them at retail to a clientele composed mostly of women from the area.
With this loan, he foresees realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on his loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy used cotton oil and lye

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María una humilde señora de 59 años es cliente Kiva, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a una pulpería, esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado, porque poco a poco gracias al financiamiento obtenidos  ha ido creciendo como comerciante,  ya que con el primer préstamo pudo agregar más inventario a su pulpería como granos básicos, pan huevos, enlatados, ya que  de esta  manera ha podido ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes.
Está requiriendo de su segundo financiamiento para invertir en lo mismo como granos básicos, pan, huevos, aceite, vegetales. Uno de sus propósitos es  incrementar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para mantenerlo estable.
texts.en: María a modest woman, she is 59 years old and a Kiva client. She is shop-keeper; she runs a grocery store. She is grateful for the support she has been shown because, little by little, thanks to the financing she has obtained, she has been able grow as a businesswoman. Her first loan allowed her to add more inventory to her store; like basic grains, bread, eggs, canned goods and in this way she was able to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. She needs a second loan to invest in the same kind of goods: basic grains, bread, eggs, oil and vegetables. One of her goals is to obtain higher earnings so she can continue to invest in her business and keep business stable.

loans.use: purchase basic grains, bread, eggs, oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Salimata  est mariée, âgée de 38 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame chez son mari dans  la ville de Koutiala ( région de Sikasso ). 
Elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire les études, raisons pour laquelle elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités, elle opta pour la restauration depuis des années. Très entreprenante, elle est très bien connue dans le secteur, dont sa notoriété est bonne, car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de rejoindre  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a plus de 5 ans. Elle est à son 6ème  prêt  individuel.  Avec ce financement, Salimata  compte acheter  des sacs de haricot, de riz et de l’huile pour les stockés afin de faire ses beignets. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants du grand marché de Koutiala et  effectue sa vente d’aliments devant sa maison  à Koutiala, à une clientèle mixte au comptant. Elle espère  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Salimata is a 38-year-old married mother of six children. She lives in her husband's polygamous household in the city of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region).
She did not have the chance to attend school, which is why she became involved in income-generating activities with her mother from an early age. After having run several activities, she decided on running a catering business several years ago. A very enterprising woman, she is very well known in her area, and her reputation is good, since she receives many customers each day. To satisfy her clientele and expand the size of her business, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso over five years ago. She is on her sixth individual loan. With this financial support, Salimata intends to buy bags of beans, rice, and oil to stock in order to make fritters. She gets her supplies from the merchants at the grand market in Koutiala and makes her food sales in cash in front of her house in Koutiala to a diverse clientele. She hopes to realize an average profit of 50,000 FCFA per month, which will be used to pay the interest on her loan and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bissighin Wendwaogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SALFO représente le  groupe BISSIGHIN WENDWAOGO. Sur la photo, Salfo n'a pas levé la main mais est assis devant sa machine à coudre. Marié, Il est père d’un enfant. Il a 1an 02mois. L’enfant ne  va  à l’école et il a 01 personne  en charge.
Mr  est couturier depuis 09 ans.  Il s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et enfants.
Il veut s’acheter  une vitrine et des mannequins.
Il  veut renforcer son activité  avec ses bénéfices. Mr ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et reconstruire sa maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Salfo is the leader of the "Bissighin Wendwaogo" group. In the photo, he does not have his hand raised, but is sitting in front of the sewing machine.
He is married and has one child, who is one year and two months old. The child does not attend school, and Mr. Salfo has one person in his care.
Mr. Salfo has been a tailor for nine years. He gets his supplies at the market in sector 10. His customers are men, women, and children.
He would like to buy a window display and mannequins.
He wants to strengthen his business with his profits. His ambition is to improve his family's standard of living and rebuild his house.

loans.use: To buy a window display and mannequins

loans.name: Tintina

texts.fr:
Tintina est âgée de  58 ans environ, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est polygame  et vit chez son époux dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Tintina n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, raison pour laquelle elle s’est basée sur le commerce depuis à bas âge. Elle exerce cette activité (préparation et vente de Sounbala) depuis plusieurs années, le Sounbala est l’un des condiments essentiels des femmes Maliennes. Tintina est très sollicitée par sa clientèle, car elle reçoit des commandes importantes à travers les régions du Mali, pour cela cette activité est beaucoup prometteuse. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et élargir son activité, elle a sollicité le partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 7 ans. Elle a pris des prêts dans le groupe (prêt solidaire ) et elle est à son 6ème prêt  individuel dont les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs de 100Kg de soja auprès des vendeurs de céréales de Koutiala, elle effectue ses ventes, après préparation du Sounbala, à Koutiala, Bamako, Kayes et d’autres villes à une clientèle composée de femmes généralement, au comptant et souvent à crédit.  Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des ses échéances, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Tintina is about 58 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her husband in a polygamous household in the city of Koutiala.
Tintina did not have the chance to attend school, which is why she began working at an early age. She has run her current business (preparing and selling sumbala, a fermented paste used as a condiment) for several years - sumbala is an essential condiment for Malian women. Tintina is highly sought-after by her clientele, since she receives significant orders throughout the regions of Mali, and for this reason her business is very promising. 
To increase her capital in order to satisfy her customers and expand her business, she sought a partnership with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. She has obtained group (solidarity) loans, and she is on her sixth individual loan, all the previous ones having been repaid without difficulty. With this new loan, she intends to buy fifteen 100-kg bags of soybeans from the cereal vendors in Koutiala. After preparing sumbala, she makes her sales in Koutiala, Bamako, Kayes, and other cities, in cash and often on credit to a clientele composed generally of women. She intends to earn a monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA with this loan, which she will use to repay her debt, contribute to the improvement of her family's standard of living, and invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy soybeans.

loans.name: La Source Group

texts.fr: La cliente Tulia  est entrepreneur, conseillère et doyenne du groupe d’affaire la Source, âgée de plus de 60 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Ses fils aîné et cadette sont respectivement âgés de 43 ans et 28 ans. Son mari est un chauffeur. La cliente est vendeuse des boissons sucrées (Fanta, Coca). Elle vend ses produits à son domicile. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds  reçu de son mari. Il y a plus de 3 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises (32 casiers de Fanta sucré et Coca).En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, passer le reste de sa vie en paix avec ses enfants et petits fils. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: The borrower Tulia is an entrepreneur, and is advice-giver and representative of the business group 'La Source'. She is over 60 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Her eldest and youngest children are, respectively, 43 and 28 years old. Her husband is a driver. The borrower sells sweet drinks (Fanta, Coke). She sells her products from home. She started her business with funds received from her husband. She has been in business more than three years. This new loan will be used for her to stock up on new merchandise (32 racks of Fanta and Coke). Additionally, her ambition is to grow her business and to spend the rest of her life peacefully with her husband and grandchildren. The borrower thanks Hekima for its actions dedicated to poor women not served by traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise (32 racks of Fanta and Coke)

loans.name: Rugwasanye Group

texts.fr: Madame Muderhwa  est une cliente ambitieuse du groupe de credit  Rugwasanye.  Elle est mère de 4 enfants scolarisés à l’âge  de 40ans. Elle est mariée à un artiste et vend  des produits vivriers au marche central de la ville depuis sa jeunesse.  Elle sollicite ce credit pour s’approvisionner en  12 sacs de 100kilos de haricots et 10 de 25kilos de riz de 1ere qualité. Elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et finir leurs études grâce aux fruits de son travail ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour son appui.
texts.en: Ms. Muderhwa is an ambitious member of the Rugwasanye loan group. She is 40 years old and has four children in school. She is married to an artist and has sold food products at the central market in the city since her youth. She is seeking this loan to supply herself with twelve 100-kg bags of beans and ten 25-kg bags of top quality rice. She hopes to see her children grow and finish their studies thanks to the fruits of her labour, and she is thus grateful to Hekima for its support.

loans.use: To buy twelve 100-kg bags of beans and ten 25-kg bags of top quality rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like vegetables, for example, cabbages, kale, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Madame  Riziki est une femme dynamique de l’association d’affaire confiance.  Elle est mariée à un homme sans emploi depuis plus de 25 ans. Agée de 52ans, elle est mère  de 9 enfants tous scolarisés.  Elle avait débutée son commerce par l’entraide  de son mari avant de regagner l’association d’affaire confiance dont elle fait partie depuis plus de 2ans.  Elle sollicite ce credit pour acheter 20 bidons de lait (yaourt) de  10 litres en termes de provision. Elle souhaite une bonne continuité de ses activités afin d’assurer l’avenir de sa famille. Elle remercie pour son prêt.
texts.en: Madame Riziki is a dynamic woman from the business group 'Confiance' (Confidence). She has been married to a man without a job for over 25 years. 52 years old, she is the mother of nine children, all in school. She started her business through the assistance of her husband before gaining the confidence of the business group that she has now been part of for over two years. She is asking for this loan in order to buy 20 ten liter containers of milk (yogurt) as stock. She wishes to continue her business in order to provide for her family's future. She is thankful for this loan.

loans.use: to buy 20 ten liter containers of milk (yogurt)

loans.name: Nadège Pulcherie

texts.fr: Nadège est une femme de 31 ans, célibataire et mère de 3 enfants. Elle possède et gère un petit kiosque dans un coin de la ville depuis 7 ans où elle vend des crédits de communications. Dynamique et accueillant, elle considère que son stock de crédits est déjà insuffisant pour sa clientèle grandissante. le crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter le crédit de communication en gros auprès de fournisseurs (grossistes d'Orange et de MTN). Les bénéfices escomptés vont lui permettra d'augmenter son capital et son activité et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, santé)
texts.en: Nadège is a 31 year old woman, single and the mother of three children. She has owned and managed a small kiosk in an area of the city for seven years, where she sells telephone cards. Dynamic and welcoming, she considers her stock of phone cards to be insufficient for her growing number of customers. The loan that she is asking for will allow her to buy phone cards in bulk from suppliers (wholesalers from Orange and MTN). The profits she expects will allow her to increase her capital and grow her business and to provide for her family's needs (education, nutrition, health).

loans.use: to buy phone cards.

loans.name: Femmes Battantes Group

texts.fr:
Mme  AMINATA  est responsable du groupe  FEMMES BATTANTES. Mariée, elle est mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 40 ans et le moins âgés à 16 ans. Personne ne va  à l’école et elle a 04 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend du combustible depuis 22ans.  Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. Ses clients sont les  habitants de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter  une rangée de combustible.	
Elle veut  avec  ses bénéfices  renforcer  son activité. Mme  ambitionne pouvoir se faire livré tout  un chargement (camion entier) de combustible.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata is the leader of the "Femmes Battantes" group. She is a married mother of eight children. The oldest is 40 and the youngest is 16. None of them attend school currently, and Ms. Aminata has four people in her care.
Ms. Aminata has sold fuel for 22 years. She gets her supplies delivered to her house. Her customers are the people who live in her area.
She would like to buy a range of fuel items.
With her profits, she would like to strengthen her business. Ms. Aminata's ambition is to have an entire truckload of fuel delivered.

loans.use: To buy a range of fuel items.

loans.name: Temple Eliel Group

texts.fr:
Mme  T.CLARISSE  est responsable du groupe  TEMPLE ELIEL. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 06 ans et le moins âgés à 02 ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des condiments depuis 07ans.  Elle s’approvisionne aux  marchés  de  son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter  un carton de poisson sec.	
Elle  veut réinvestir  ses bénéfices  dans son activité. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son activité et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Clarisse is the leader of the "Temple Eliel" group. She is a married mother of two children. The older child is 6 and the younger is 2. One of them attends school, and Ms. T. Clarisse has two people in her care.
Ms. T. Clarisse has sold condiments for seven years. She gets her supplies at the markets in her area. Her customers are women from the area.
She would like to buy a box of dried fish.
She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a box of dried fish.

loans.name: Chilerabana Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ciza est présidente du groupe d’affaire Chilerabana, âgée de 40 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants  tous scolarisés. Son mari est cultivateur. La cliente fait le petit commerce des produits vivriers et  grâce aux bénéfices de ses affaires elle arrive à supporter sa famille. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner en des nouvelles marchandises dont 50 pièces de poisons salés, ½  de poissons fumés et 1 sac de fretins. En plus, elle voudrait  agrandir son entreprise et assurer une bonne survie à famille. La cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en: Ciza is the president of the Chilerabana business group. She is 40 years old, married, and has eight children, all in school. Her husband is a farmer. Ciza runs a small business selling food products and, thanks to the profits from this activity, manages to support her family. This new loan will serve to supply her with new merchandise, including 50 sets of salted fish, half a set of smoked fish, and one bag of small fry. In addition, she would like to expand her business and ensure a good standard of living for her family. Ciza is grateful to the microfinance institution Hekima for its work.

loans.use: To buy 50 sets of salted fish, half a set of smoked fish, and one bag of small fry.

loans.name: Sababougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme AZILA JUDITH  représente le  groupe  SABABOUGNOUMA. Mariée, elle est mère d’un enfant. Il est  âgé de 02 ans. L’enfant ne va à l’école et elle a 03 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend du combustible depuis 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile. Ses clients sont les habitants du quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter  une rangé de combustible.	
Elle  veut  renforcer  son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  dans l’avenir ouvrir un kiosque et mieux s’occuper  de son enfant.
texts.en:
Ms. Azila Judith is the leader of the "Sababougnouma" group. She is married and has one child. He is two years old. He does not attend school, and Ms. Azila Judith has three people in her care.
Ms. Azila Judith has sold fuel for ten years. She gets her supplies delivered to her home. Her customers are people living in her area.
She would like to buy a range of fuel items.
She wants to strengthen her business with the profits. Her ambition in the future is to open a kiosk and take better care of her child.

loans.use: To buy a range of fuel items.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is grateful for the first loan he received because it helped him progress. He was able to meet the family's needs and repay the loan on time.

Wilfred is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to purchase poultry and chicken feed, and to renovate the poultry house. He desires to be a renowned supplier of poultry products in the area and is on course to achieving his target.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and chicken feed, and to renovate the poultry house.

loans.name: Adèle Françoise

texts.fr: Adèle est une femme de 38 ans, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants. Elle gère un petit bar dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle y vend des boissons hygiéniques. Elle a acquis au cours de ces années une expérience ce qui lui a permis de gagner une clientèle considérable mais son stock de marchandises ne permet plus de la satisfaire. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons et renforcer son stock de marchandises (boissons hygiéniques). Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité et le reste sera injecter dans l'achat du terrain et pour les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Adèle is a 38 year old woman, single and the mother of two children. She has run a small bar in an area of the city for seven years. There she sells beverages. Over the course of these years she has acquired experience, which allows her to reach a considerable number of customers, but her merchandise stock doesn't allow her to satisfy them anymore. She is therefore asking for this loan in order to be able to buy more racks of drinks and to reinforce her stock of beverages. The profits that this loan will bring her will be in part reinvested in her business and the rest will be used to be land and for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy beverages for her bar.

loans.name: Yamb Yel Benewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme  TENE  est responsable du groupe  YAMB YEL BENEWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgés à 09 ans. Les 04 vont  à l’école et elle a 04 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend de condiments et haricot depuis  09ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  20 plats d’haricot et des condiments.	
Elle veut  avec  ses bénéfices  réinvestir dans  son activité. Mme  ambitionne s’acheter  un motocycle.
texts.en:
Ms. Tene is the leader of the "Yamb Yel Benewende" group. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 22 and the youngest is 9. All four children attend school, and Ms. Tene has four people in her care.
Ms. Tene has sold condiments and beans for nine years. She gets her supplies at the market in her area. Her customers are women.
She would like to buy twenty plates of beans and condiments.
She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy twenty plates of beans and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell in her retail shop such as clothes, basins, cups, shoes etc.

loans.name: Sylviane

texts.fr: Sylviane est une femme de 32 ans, célibataire et mère de 02 enfants dont les âges sont 17 ans et 12 ans. elle possède et gère un cafétéria dans un coin de la ville depuis 1 an où elle vend des déjeuner (omelette, café,...). Elle sollicite le crédit pour acheter des matières premières (lait, pattes, vivres frais, oeufs, tartine etc) pour augmenter son niveau de stock de matières premières afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires ainsi que son profit.Le profit dégagé sera utilisé pour réinvestir dans son activité d'une part et le reste pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Sylviane is a 32 year old woman, single and mother of two children, who are 17 and 12 years old. She has owned and managed a cafe in an area of the city for a year where she sells lunches (omelets, coffee...). She is asking for the loan in order to buy ingredients (milk, dough, fresh food, eggs, spreads, etc.) in order to increase her ingredient stock so that she can increase her revenue as well as her profits. The profit will be used in part as a reinvestment in her business and the rest will be used to satisfy her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Abror

texts.ru:
Аброр пожилой человек в возрасте 62 лет.  Он женат имеет четверых  детей. Трое из детей уже обзавелись семьями а один не может женится так как не хватает денежных средств. Сам Аброр столяр. Дополнительно занимается выращиванием хлопка и лука. Но все что он зарабатывает все уходит на проживание. Не смотря на свой возраст Аброр очень энергичный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Его сын достаточна вырос и пора его женить поэтому Аброр обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.
 На полученный кредит Аброр планирует провести мероприятие сына и купить ему приданое. Очень надеется на помощь и поддержку от организации Кива и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Abror is an elderly man of 62. He is married and has four children. Three of his children already have their own families, but he cannot get married because he is short of money. Abror himself is a carpenter, and he also raises cotton and onions. But everything he earns is just enough for him to get by. Despite his age, Abror is a very energetic and industrious man. His son is now grown up and it is time for him to get married. So Abror has turned to Arvand for financial assistance. Abror plans to host his son's event and buy him a wedding dowry. He eagerly looks forward to receiving help and support from Kiva and thanks them in advance.

loans.use: to buy a wedding dowry for  son

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул 29 лет, замужем, воспитывает двоих детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с августа 2012 года Миргул занимается торговлей товаров народного потребления. Стартовав с суммы в 30,000 сом (KGS), Миргул смогла развить бизнес с ежемесячной прибылью в 8,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Миргул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку большего количества товара, расширить ассортимент. Доходы Миргул планирует вложить приобретение арендуемого здания магазина.
texts.en: Mirgnul is 29 years old, and is raising two children. As the main breadwinner in her family, Mirgnul has been selling consumer products since August 2012. After starting out with 30,000 soms (KGS), Mirgnul has successfully grown her business so that it earns a monthly profit of 8,000 soms. With the goal of developing her business further, Mirgnul has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 soms (KGS) to buy a larger number of products and increase her selection. Mirgnul plans on investing the proceeds from the loan into leasing a building for her store.

loans.use: To increase the selection of goods in her store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She owns rental houses and has been in this business for the last seven years. Agnes is married and has six school-going children. She is also a farmer, keeping dairy animals and rabbits.
Agnes was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit for business operations. She is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to renovate her houses and also pay for her children's school fees. The challenge in the current business has been delays in rent payments.
The additional income from the invested loan will help her continue paying the required school fees.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses and also pay for her children's school fees.

loans.name: San Francisco S. B. Group

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene 25 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara con su familia. 
Ella siempre se a dedicado al comercio, anteriormente vendía mercadería de ropa y hace 3 años se dedico a la elaboración de pan casero. Ella hace pan de semitas, quesadillas, torta de leche, salporas y otros. Este producto lo vende en la comunidad,  ha sido un negocio rentable.  Y espera a futuro llegar a tener una panadería. 
Actualmente esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF, en forma grupal.  El grupo se denomina San Francisco S.B. y esta formado por tres integrantes, en la foto esta Rosa a la derecha con delantal, a la izquierda doña Juana de blusa blanco y doña María de blusa rayada roja con blanco. Las tres se dedican  a la elaboración de pan y viven en al misma comunidad. 
El préstamo grupal es por 25,000 lempiras y lo van a invertir en la compra de insumos como harina, manteca, azúcar, huevos, leche, levadura, margarina y vainilla, con el objetivo de incrementar la producción y las ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 25 years old, married, and has a son. She lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara with her family. She has always had a business; previously she sold clothing merchandise, and three years ago started making homemade bread.

She makes sweet rolls, quesadillas, milk cakes, cookies and other baked goods. She sells this product in the community, and it has been a profitable business. In the future, she hopes to succeed in having a bakery.

Currently she is requesting a second loan from ODEF, as part of a group loan. The group is called "San Francisco" and is made up of three members. Rosa is seen in the photo, on the right, wearing an apron. On the left is Juana, in a white blouse, and Maria in a blouse with red and white stripes. The three of them make bread and live in the same community.

The group loan is for 25,000 lempiras, and they're going to use it to buy ingredients such as flour, lard, sugar, eggs, milk, yeast, margarine and vanilla,  with the aim of increasing their output and earnings.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making bread, such as flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, margarine, milk, vanilla and lard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married business man. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been operating for two years. Besides this, he also sells water.

He learned about Milango through a friend, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is bad debts owed by his customers.

Benson is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings, to buy additional stock of retail items for his inventory, like soap, flour, milk, and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, to improve the living standard of his family. His aspiration is to grow the business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of retail items, like soap, flour, milk, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a resident of Malindi, in Kenya. She owns rental houses and has been in this business for the past three years. Margaret is married and has three school-going children.
 
Margaret was introduced to Milango by her friends, and she joined to access credit for business operations. She is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings, to complete the construction of one of her rental houses, and to buy cement and paint to renovate her other houses. The challenge in the current business has been delays by tenants in paying their rent.

The additional income from investing the loan in her business, will help her continue paying the required school fees for her children.

loans.use: to complete the construction of one of her rental houses, and to buy cement and paint to renovate her other houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients and supplies to prepare the food she offers.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos de 37 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Carlos anteriormente se dedicaba solo a la compra venta de granos básicos. Y hace 1 año decidió comercializar frutas y verduras.  Tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado local y vende bananos, manzanas, pataste, culantro, rábano, chile, tomate, apio, zanahoria, repollo, remolacha, y otros. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo de 5,000 lempiras para capitalizarse y surtir de frutas y verduras frescas. Este negocio tiene buena demanda porque es de consumo diario. El tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y en el futuro cuando tenga sus hijos poderles dar lo mejor.
texts.en: Carlos, 37, is single and lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Previously, Carlos had a business where he was selling only basic grains.  But a year ago, he decided to sell fruits and vegetables.  He has a sales stall in the local market where he sells bananas, apples, chayote, cilantro, radishes, peppers, tomatoes, celery, carrots, cabbage, beets, and other produce.  He decided to request a loan for 5,000 Honduran lempiras to capitalize his business so that he can stock up on fresh fruits and vegetables.  This business sees strong demand because the products he sells are consumed daily.  Carlos' goal is to grow the business so that in the future, when he has children, he can provide them with the best.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kudratkul

texts.ru:
Кудраткул мужчина в возрасте 40 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей.  Его жена домохозяйка. Кудраткул занимается выращиванием скота. Он дома откармливает скот. Дети и жена помогают ему в этом бизнесе. У них имеется дойная корова и жена продает соседям молоко и молочные продукты. Это их единственный доход в семье поэтому они стараются развивать свой бизнес. Так как сам Кудраткул в свое время не смог получить высшее образование, он мечтает чтобы его дети учились и в будущем работали по профессии. 
 На полученный кредит Кудраткул хочет приобрести скот и корма для скота. Он планирует откормить  скот до весны и продать по выгодной цене. Кудраткул очень благодарен организации Кива за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Kudratkul is a 40-year-old married man and the father of three children.  While his wife is a homemaker, he breeds cattle and fattens it at home.  His wife and children help him with his business.  They have a dairy cow and Kudratkul's wife sells milk and dairy products to their neighbors.  This is the family's only source of income, and this is why they are trying to expand their business.

Since Kudratkul was not able to get a higher education when he was young, he is hoping that his children will study and have good jobs.  With his loan, Kudratkul wants to buy some cattle and cattle feed.  He is planning to fatten up his cattle until the spring and to sell it at a profitable price.  He is very thankful to Kiva for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
Doña Isidra  tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en la ciudad de León, inicia a ofertar su producto a las 5:00 am y finaliza a las 6 pm de lunes a domingo en este mismo horario, siendo  este trabajo el que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre soltera de tres hijas. 

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar frutas y verdura al por mayor por eso acudió a  Ceprodel para poder ser beneficiada con un crédito y seguir comercializando las riquísimas y jugosas frutas de la temporada y así satisfacer la demanda de su gran clientela y obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia ya que esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 14 años, teniendo buenos resultados en sus ventas. Ella sueña  que su negocio siga creciendo cada días más.
texts.en:
Isidra has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the city of León. She begins to offer her products at 5:00 a.m. and finishes at 6:00 p.m., with the same schedule from Monday through Sunday, since this is the work that allows her to sustain her family as she is the single mother of three daughters.

One of the needs she has is to buy wholesale fruit and vegetables, which is why she turned to Ceprodel. She would like the benefit of a loan so she can continue selling delicious, juicy seasonal fruits and meet the demand of her large client base, and obtain the income for the well-being of her family since she has been working at this for 14 years and has had good sales results. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow more every day.

loans.use: to buy bananas, tomatoes, onions and peppers

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
El señor Hermegenes es soltero, de la ciudad de Santaní. Es propietario de una despensa en su casa particular, con clientela formada, también realiza repartos en su motocicleta, vende medicamentos en general  y bolsitas. 
El es una persona muy trabajadora cuya meta es poder seguir creciendo para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y afrontar los gastos del día a día. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa y así seguir trabajando y ganando mejor.
texts.en:
Hermegenes is single and from the city of Santaní. He is the owner of a store in his private house, with regular customers, he also makes deliveries on his motorcycle, he sells medicines and tea bags.He is a hard worker whose goal is to be able to continue growing to be able to continue helping his family and to take care of the day to day expenses. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies for his store and thus continue working and earning more.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité "Mujeres Valientes"tiene mas de 2 años de formación y trabajo con la fundación y están trabajando con mucho entusiasmo y ganas igual al primer día.
La Sra. Crescencia es una  integrante de éste comité , se unió al grupo por la necesidad de tener un medio que le permita generar mas ingresos , para solventar los diversos gastos del hogar , y también la educación de sus hijos , realiza venta de comestibles en forma ambulante. Anhela un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerza todos los días para darles la oportunidad de estudiar y lograr un futuro mejor.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Valientes" (Valiant Women) has more than 2 years of experience and working with the foundation. They are working with great enthusiasm and as much will as on their first day.

Señora Crescencia is a member of this group. She joined the group out of the need to have a means of generating more income to pay the various household expenses and also for the education of her children. She sells food as a street vendor. She aspires to a better future for her children, and this is why she strives every day to give them the opportunity to study and achieve a better future.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meats, condiments, and other ingredients to be able to continue making the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and other ingredients for the food she sells

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 55 años de edad, es viuda, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa de la ciudad de Ybycui. Nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de leche y queso, y que empezó este negocio junto con su marido hace más de 20 años, fue formando clientes gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, en la actualidad posee clientela  formada.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de balanceados para sus vacas, ya que estas son su medio de salir adelante y tener los ingresos suficientes para dar a su familia. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que con eso podrá comprar más alimentos para sus vacas para que tengan una mayor producción y así brindarles a sus clientes la mejor atención.
texts.en:
Rosa is 55 years old, widowed, and lives with her two children in their home in the town of Ybycui. She sells milk and cheese, a business which she started with her late husband over 20 years ago. 

She gained customers over time due to the high quality of her products and now has a solid customer base. She is requesting the loan to buy a balanced diet for her cows, because she relies on them to make a living and to have enough income for her family. 

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya becuase she will be able to buy more food for her cows so that they have a higher production and in this way she can offer more to her customers.

loans.use: to buy nutritional food for her cows.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Divino Niño ", es un comité con 15 integrantes se encuentran en el segundo  ciclo.  Todas son mujeres trabajadoras, el  comité está situado en  la ciudad de Curuguaty. El Comité Divino Niño se compromete  de seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad que venían haciendo.
Maria, una de las miembros se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas y comenta que sus ventas están mejorando mucho, ya que las prendas usadas son más baratas. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas para poder revenderlas y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Divino Niño" (Divine Child) is a group of 15 members who are in their second loan cycle. All are hard-working women. The group is from the city of Curuguaty. The group Divino Niño promises to continue working with the same responsibility that they have been showing. 

Maria, one of the members, sells used clothing and comments that her sales are improving a lot, since used clothing is cheaper. She is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of clothing to resell and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Divinas” se encuentra en el décimo séptimo ciclo del programa. Todas se sacrifican cada día para dar a sus familias un futuro distinto del que a ella toco vivir, formándolos para ser hombres y mujeres de provecho para la sociedad.
Ezequiela es miembro de este grupo y por medio de la costura saca adelante a su familia, ella es una persona que ha demostrado en cada ciclo que quiere salir adelante y que por eso se esfuerza. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos, y así poder tener un buen stock de ellos para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: The committee "Las Divinas" is in the seventeenth cycle of its program. All the women sacrifice each day to give their families a different future, shaping their children to be men and women who contribute to society. Ezequiela is a member of this group who supports her family through sewing. She is someone who has demonstrated in each cycle that she wants to get ahead and that this is why she is exerting herself. Now she is requesting this loan in order to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabric and thread and be well-stocked to be able to complete her customers' orders.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando El Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité  “ Mujeres Buscando el Porvenir;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con once integrantes. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas, escasos recursos, por lo que reciben muy pocas atenciones y beneficios. Hoy gracias a la fundación paraguaya ellas pudieron  lograr  realizar   los trabajos tanto dentro del comité como en la familia.
Liz, una de las miembros tiene una despensa y también se dedica a la cría de animales, ella es una persona que desde siempre se ha esforzado por su meta y quiere seguir haciéndolo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, y también para balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Buscando el Porvenir" (women seeking the future) is now in its second loan cycle, with eleven members. All are very sacrificing women of scarce resources; consequently they receive very little consideration and advantages. Now, thanks to Fundación Paraguaya, they can manage to accomplish their work as much within the committee as in their families.

Liz, one of the members, has a grocery store and also raises animals. She is a person who has always strived for her goal and wants to continue doing so. She is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of stock for her store and also for balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store and balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Ñepytyvora Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Ñepytyvora” es un Comité más del Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación, está conformado por 1 mujeres trabajadoras, son vecinas  cuentan con una actividad fija es decir se dedican a la cría de animales como chancho, gallinas, Modista,; son muy trabajadoras y humildes.
Alice cría animales de corral, y con mucho esfuerzo da a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades. Ella desea que el día de mañana tenga una hermosa granja con más animales.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales para seguir alimentándolos como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The " Ñepytyvora” communal bank is part of the Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación. It is comprised of 11 hard-working women who are neighbors. All of them have jobs, for example, raising animals like pigs and hens, dressmaking, etc. They are very hard-working and humble. 

Alicia raises farmyard animals and works hard to give her family the things they need every day so that they do not have to go without. She dreams of having a beautiful farm with more animals. She is requesting this loan in order to buy balanced food for her animals so that she can keep feeding them as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for her livestock.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité  San Miguel;  tiene 13 miembros y están en su cuarto ciclo, son mujeres de escasos recursos que vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de la fundación paraguaya y con el están saliendo adelante.
Amada tiene una despensa con los productos de primera necesidad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que tiene como meta poder ir agrandando su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo como persona y microempresaria.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa y así seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Miguel" has 13 members and is in its fourth loan cycle. They are women of scarce resources who saw a great opportunity in the Fundación Paraguaya program, and with it they are advancing.

Amada has a store with basic products to offer to her customers. She is a very hard-working person who has a goal of continuing to enlarge her business and in this way be able to continue growing as a person and as a microentrepreneur. She is applying for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of stock for her store and thus continue giving a good selection to her customers.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Belen Group

texts.es:
El comité cuenta con 12 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedique por más pequeña que sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias, el trabajo en equipo y utilizando todos sus recursos disponibles hace que sus luchas su mayor fortaleza 
Reinalda es vendedora ambulante y por medio de su sacrificado trabajo saca adelante a su familia. Ella se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora, que no teme a los desafío y que se anima a hacer cualquier cosa para ayudar a los suyos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para revenderlos y así seguir mejorando su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
This group has 12 members, all of whom work in a little business, no matter how small it is. The women feel very excited by the mutual support among them, which is constant and above all inspires them with the will to continue striving for their families. Their work as a team and utilizing all their available resources make their efforts their greatest strength.

Reinalda is a street vendor, and through her selfless work she is raising her family. She defines herself as a very hard-working person who does not fear challenges and dares to do anything to help her family. She is applying for this loan to buy items to resell and thus continue improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras 2 Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a las Señora Laura quien se esforzó en formar este grupo fue para ayudar a cada una de ellas ya que todas tienen ganas de salir adelante por todo el esfuerzo que están realizando para surgir como comité y crecer juntas todas las señoras.
Laura es peluquera, y comenta que siempre trata de poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientas, cuenta que se ha hecho de muy buena fama y de clientela ya que siempre da un buen servicio. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con grandes metas que quiere cumplir.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, peines y demás insumos para abastecer su peluquería.
texts.en:
This communal bank was formed thanks to Señora Laura, who made the effort to form the group. It was done to help each one of them, since all have the will to advance through all the effort that they are making to develop as a group and to grow along with all the other women. 

Laura is a hairdresser, and she comments that she always tries to give good service to her customers. She says that she has become very well known and has a good customer base since she gives good service. She is a very hard-working person with great goals that she wants to accomplish. She is applying for this loan to purchase shampoo, rinses, combs, and other supplies to stock her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, combs, and other items.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El comité ´´San Sebastián” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes. La Sra. Adolfina se dedica a la producción de queso que luego sale a vender en su comunidad, tiene muy buena clientela ya que siempre da productos muy buenos, y que son pedidos por muchos de sus clientes. tiene gran éxito debido a que es una persona muy buena en lo que hace y que gusta mucho a los clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus quesos y así seguir obteniendo los medios para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Sebastián" was formed by the union of a number of neighbors from the city of Santaní. All the members of the group are developing independent businesses.

Señora Adolfina makes cheese that she later goes out to sell in her community. She has very good customers, since she always makes products that are very good and that are ordered by many of her customers. She has great success due to the fact that she is very good at what she does and the customers like her a lot. She is applying for this loan to purchase supplies to continue making her cheeses and thus continue obtaining the means to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cheese.

loans.name: Amgalantor

texts.en:
Mr Amgalantor is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger in the Sainshand district of Dornogobi province, Mongolia. His wife Naranchimeg, aged 28, works in a small cafeteria as a chef. His eight-year-old daughter Sansarmaa and six-year-old daughter Sansarbayar, study at the local primary school, while their younger daughter Sarangua, aged three, goes to the local kindergarten. 

Amgalantor has been running his taxi service business in town since 2009. He has been driving for more than 10 years and he is well-known for his safe and qualified service among customers. He is now requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase a second hand eco-friendly electric and gas-powered car for his taxi service because his car is very old and needs replacement as it breaks down all the time. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand eco-friendly electric and gas-powered car for his taxi business

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Emprendedoras  se encuentra en el 2º ciclo es de la ciudad de Santaní y está integrado por 13 señoras. La Señora Elvira, una de las integrantes se dedica a la venta de comidas su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico que le permite tener una mayor cantidad de clientes y así a toda su familia se mantiene.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, hortalizas, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende, ya que con esto ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para tener una mejor vida a la que ella tuvo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurs) is in its second loan cycle in the city of Santani. It consists of 13 women.

Señora Elvira, one of the members, sells food. Her business is located in a strategic place that allows her to have a larger number of customers, and thus she supports her whole family. She is applying for this loan to buy meat, greens, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies to be able to continue making the foods that she sells, since with this she helps her family and gives them everything that they need to have a better life that she had.

loans.use: to buy meats, greens, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is a 45-year-old widow who lives with her sister and brother in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her sister, Oyunchimeg, age 37, and brother, Nergui, age 37, help her to grow and sell organic vegetables on their plot of land. She has been growing organic vegetables for years and stores them in their storage pit to sell during winter, when the price has raised to the highest level. She rents a counter in a local market and sells her organic vegetables. 

She is now requesting 6,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase soils, seeds and other necessary items for the next planting. She is a hardworking and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase soils, seeds and other necessary items for next plantation.

loans.name: Anhzaya

texts.en:
Mr. Anhzaya is 22 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife, Nyamchimeg, age 22, works at a local market as a saleswoman and has recently given birth to their daughter Misheel, age 1. She takes care of their daughters, including Anhdolgoon, age 2. 

He has been working in a local company since 2009 and grows organic vegetables on their plot of land to sell to local customers. He is now requesting 1,100,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase insulation material to install in their Ger in order to stay warm during winter. He is a hardworking and welcoming man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to install in their Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in order to stay warm during winter.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité ´´Kuña Kyrey” se formó con la unión de 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, donde todas se dedican a la cría de animal y a la agricultura, algunas de ellas faenan sus chanchos y gallinas para luego  vender  en mercado de la ciudad, otras venden verduras y hortalizas.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
Nancy, la presidenta, se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Kuña Kyrey” formed with the joining up of 10 women in the city of Santaní, where they all work raising animals and in agriculture. Some of them slaughter their pigs and chickens in order to sell them later at the market in the city; others sell vegetables and produce. The members form a very united group that is capable of carrying out activities together that strengthen their team spirit. 

Nancy, the president, works raising and selling animals. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of feed for her animals, in order to continue working and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” tiene 12 miembros, lleva este nombre el grupo ya que todas son muy trabajadoras y es eso lo que significa la frase kuña guapa.
Todas las miembros de este grupo son muy trabajadoras y han demostrado que con esfuerzo y ganas de salir adelante todo se puede. Fermina es la presidenta de este grupo, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, y cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado pues es de tiempo completo. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados y trigo para sus animales para poder tenerlos bien alimentados y seguir con sus trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Kuña Guapa” has 12 members. The group took this name because all of them are very hardworking, and this is the meaning of the phrase “kuña guapa”. All the members of this group are very industrious, and they have demonstrated that with effort and a desire to get ahead, anything can be done. 

Fermina is the president of this group. She works raising and selling farm animals, and she says that this work is very demanding because it’s full-time. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of feed and wheat for her animals, in order to have them well-fed and continue with her work.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and wheat.

loans.name: Anhzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Anhzaya is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and son in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Dorjsuren, age 33, works at a local private company as an assistant worker. Her son, Monhtemuulen, age 14, goes to a local school. 

She has been working as saleswoman in a local market for years, and now she is planning to start her own grocery store business in the spare room of her house. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase starting inventory for her grocery store. She is a hardworking, welcoming and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new grocery store business.

loans.name: Suhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Suhbat is 56 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Dolgor, works at a local company. His youngest daughter, Mongontsooj, age 13, goes to a local school. His other six children have gotten married and live separately. 

He has been running a transportation service business since he graduated from a driver's course in 1975. He bought cattle and started producing organic dairy products and selling to local customers. He is now requesting 1,900,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase forage for his cattle to feed them during winter. He is a hardworking, responsible and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase forage for his cattle to feed them during winter.

loans.name: Monhbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Monhbayar is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and son in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Baasanhuu, runs a business of selling organic fruits and vegetables from a rental counter of a local market. His son, Monhbaatar, age 10, goes to a local school. 

He has been running a transportation service business since 2007. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables and fruits for his wife's business to sell during winter. He and his wife are hardworking and honest people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables and fruits for his wife's business to sell during winter.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria comenta que gracias al crédito anterior que recibieron de Kiva pudieron dar mejores productos a sus clientes y pudieron crecer bastante, estan muy agradecidos por eso ayuda.
Hoy nuevamente se acercan para pedir otra ayuda, la cual quieren volver a invertir en su despensa para poder surtirla con mas productos y variedad de insumos, como ser bebidas, lácteos, verduras y demás insumos. Esta muy agradecida por la nueva oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria says that thanks to the previous loan that she received from Kiva, they were able to provide better products to their customers, and they were able to grow sufficiently. They are very grateful for this support.

Today they are once again interested in asking for further assistance. They want to invest again in their store to be able to stock it with more products and a variety of supplies such as beverages, dairy products, vegetables, and other supplies. She is very grateful for the new opportunity that she's receiving since it will a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, vegetables, and other goods.

loans.name: Gansuvd

texts.en: Mrs Gansuvd is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband Enh-Otgon, age 27, works as a computer repairman in a local company. Her  13-year-old daughter, Binderiya, goes to a local school. The couple also have a 10-month-old son, Anar, and so Gansuvd stays stays at home to take care of him. Her husband is planning to start his own computer service business in a rental office. Thus, Gansuvd is requesting 3,900,000 Mongolial tugriks (MNT) to purchase a scanner, a printer and other equipment to start his business. Her husband is a hardworking, well-experienced man who says: "We have a new born baby and our family expenses have increased a lot and I need to take care of my family".

loans.use: to purchase a scanner, printer and other equipment so that her husband can start a new computer service business

loans.name: Arslanbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Arslanbaatar is 26 years old. He lives with his parents and sisters in his parents' house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His parents used to work at a state-owned meat-production company for years, and are now retired and stay home. His sisters work in local companies as an accountant and an assistant worker. 

He has worked at a local company as an accountant since 2009, right after he graduated from his bachelor's-degree program. He also runs an organic meat products business in a rental counter of a local market. His parents give lots of the necessary suggestions, and he is running his organic meat products sales business successfully. He is well-known with his qualified and tasty organic meat products. 

He is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase inventory to run his organic meat products business smoothly. He is a hardworking and modest man who says, "I need to save to marry my girlfriend and move out of my parents' house; also, my parents' pension is not that much so I need to cover their living expenses, too."

loans.use: to purchase inventory to run his organic meat products business smoothly.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren is a 59-year-old widow who lives with her son and his girlfriend in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Dovdondorj, age 27, runs a taxi service business and helps his mother to run her organic vegetable business during his free-time. 

The borrower has been running a business selling organic vegetables in a rental counter of a local market since 2002. She has built close relationships with suppliers and customers over the years. She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetables in large quantity and sell during the winter. She is a hardworking, welcoming, and kind woman.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables in large quantity and sell during winter.

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamaa is 28 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Tsugjargal, has given birth to their younger son, Bayanmonh, age 1, and stays home taking care of the newborn baby. His daughter, Enhbolor, age 7, goes to a local school, and son, Erhembayar, age 5, goes to a local kindergarten. 

He has been selling running shoes from a rental counter of a local market since 2009. His wife is planning to start her own business of a butcher shop at a rental counter of a local market since they are having a newborn baby and the family expenses increased a lot. 

He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase starting inventory for his wife's newly starting butcher shop business. He and his wife both are hardworking, optimistic and welcoming people.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for his wife's newly started butcher shop business.

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee is a 52-year-old widow who lives with her son in a ger in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Buyanjargal, age 25, works at a police department as a psychologist. 

The borrower has been running a general store in a rental counter of a local market since 2003. She purchases inventory from a wholesaler, transports it with her car, and sells it to the local customers at a retail price. Her car has not been running for a while and she needs a replacement in order to run her business smoothly. 

She is now requesting 2,200,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to run her business. She is a hardworking, open-minded woman.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to run her business.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsolmon is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her son in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her youngest son, Hadbaatar, age 27, works as a driver in a local company. Her daughter has married and lives separately. 

She has been running a barber shop in a rental place for 28 years, and her daughter works with her, too. She has built close relationships with customers and already has a regular customer base. 

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a vehicle for her son to start his transportation business. She and her children are hardworking, responsible and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for her son to start his transportation business.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenetsogt is 50 years old and lives with his daughter in a small house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His daughter, Nandin-Erdene, age 10, goes to a local school. 

He has been working in a private company for years and started his own business of handcrafts by customer order at home. His wife has left him, and he needs to take care of his daughter so he quit the job and stays home running his handcraft business. He has just built a small house for his family and is now requesting 700,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase insulation material to install in his new house in order to stay warm during winter. He is a hardworking, reliable and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to install in his new house in order to stay warm during winter.

loans.name: Monhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs Monhtsetseg is a 30-year-old female head of the family who lives with her three children in Ger, in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her 9-year-old daughter, Anudari, goes to a local primary school and her 5-year-old duaghter, Anuzaya, goes to a local kindergarten. Monhtsetseg gave birth to her son, Saruulbayar, just 3 months ago. She has been running a clothing sales business since 2009. However, her business is temporarily on hold because of her pregnancy leave and maternity leave. She is now requesting 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase new clothing to restart her business in order to cover her family's expenses. As she has a new baby, her family expenses have increased. She is a hardworking, positive woman.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing to restart her clothing sales business following the birth of her son

loans.name: Davaadagva

texts.en: Davaadagva is 59 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyungerel, is 59 years old and retired. His adult children are married and live separately. Davaadagva has been running a taxi business in town since 2000. His car has broken down several times recently and he needs a replacement to run his business. He is now planning to replace his car with a better van. He is requesting a loan of 1700000 MNT to pay for the van which he will use to provide public transportation in town. He is a hardworking, experienced driver.

loans.use: to buy a replacement motor vehicle for his business

loans.name: Horolmaa

texts.en: Mrs.Horolmaa is 27 years old and lives with her husband and 2 daughters in a Ger, in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Lhagvasuren has worked at a local company for years. Her daughters Monhzul, age 5 and Monhgerel, age 2, go to local kindergarten. Horolmaa has been staying home since she gave birth to her daughters and now she is planning to start her own business of clothing sales. She used to work at the local market as a saleswoman and she has a lot of experience in the field. She is now requesting 1'500'000MNT to purchase a starting inventory for her new clothing sales business. She is a hardworking, optimistic and kind woman.

loans.use: to purchase a starting inventory for her new clothing sales business

loans.name: Taher

texts.en: Taher is 29 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who works hard to achieve a better life. He works for the General Authority for Roads, on a low income. Taher built a small house from hard-earned money, but he is suffering from a lack of money to furnish his house. He asked his friends and relatives to lend him money, but no one helped him. So, he has applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He wishes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for his house.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en: Osama is a 28-year-old married man with two children, from Taiz,Yemen. He has a diploma certificate. Osama works in a Yemen Company for Packaging Material Industry. His income is really not enough to cover all living expenses: food, rent, clothes,etc. He is hardworking and wants to start up a small business to help him pay for all his family life expenses. Osama decided to apply for a Youth loan of 100.00 YER from AMB to purchase mobile phone recharge cards for resale. He is sure that this would help him to provide much better living standards for his family. Osama looks forward to opening a mobile accessories store and building his own house when he has accumulated a good sum of money.

loans.use: to pay for buying mobile phone recharge cards for resale

loans.name: Shahira Group

texts.en:
This group has three members, all of whom work in a small business. The women feel very excited by the mutual support among them, which is constant and above all inspires them with the will to continue striving for their families. Their work as a team and utilizing all their available resources makes their efforts their greatest strength.

Fatima is a street vendor, and through her selfless work she is raising her family. She has been selling perfumes and ladies clothes. She defines herself as a very hard-working person who does not fear challenges and dares to do anything to help her family. She is applying for a youth loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy items including perfumes and ladies clothes to resell and thus continue improving her life and that of her family.

loans.use: buy items including perfumes and ladies clothes to resell

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
El comité "San Miguel Arcángel"se originó a través de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra Isidora, es Presidenta del grupo, ella Trabaja en la venta de chipa (alimento típico paraguayo) que a diario sale a vender por el barrio, su deseo es seguir progresando y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y espera muchos beneficio más, ella pondrá el mayor de su esfuerzo para que su comité surja  y salga adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipa, las cuales podrá vender y seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel Arcángel" group was set up through the promotions that were carried out in their town. All the members are from the same area, they known each other and are neighbours. The objective of each member is to work, create a communal spirit and to reach the top level of the programme.

Isidora is President of the group, she sells Chipa for a living, which is a typical Paraguayan food. Everyday she goes out to sell it around the town. Her wish is to continue progressing and for the group to get stronger everyday. She states that she feels very comfortable in the group and hopes to benefit more. She will put her greatest effort into ensuring that the group does well.

She is asking for this loan to invest it in the purchase of Chipa, which she can then sell and continue working as before.

loans.use: to buy Chipa to sell.

loans.name: Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  trabajan todas muy unidas y se encuentran  en el 4to ciclo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ana, ella tiene su propia despensa en su casa, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo. Ana cuenta que todo el sacrificio que hace es por su hijo, para poder darle todo lo que se merece y que no tenga que pasar por ninguna privación, ya que por el lucha incansablemente.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser carne, verduras, bebidas, hortalizas y demás
texts.en:
This group, from the city of Encarnación was set up because of contact with one of the foundation's members. They are very united and are in their 4th cycle.

One of the members of the group is Ana, she has her own store at home and has a son. Ana tells us that all her sacrifices have been for her son, to be able to give him everything he deserves and not have him want for anything. She struggles tirelessly for him.

She is requesting this loan to buy stock for her store, like meat, vegetables, drinks and others.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, drinks and other things

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
Este comité está en su primer ciclo, y las miembros están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y a ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Rosalina, ella tiene su propia despensa, es soltera, tiene 4  hijos. Cuenta la Sra. Rosalina que con mucho esfuerzo está sacando adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella no recibe ayuda de nadie, es una persona que pese a muchos contratiempos ha podido salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, hortalizas, carne y demás insumos para poder seguir teniendo su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en:
This group is in its first cycle and the members are learning to work together and help each other to succeed by working as a unit.

One of the group members is Rosalina, she has her own store, is single and has four children. Rosalina tells us that a lot of her effort is to support her children as she does not receive help from anyone. She is a person who, despite many setbacks, has managed to get by.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in stock for her store like vegetables, meat and other products so she can continue running a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and other things

loans.name: Kuña Pora 1 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la cuidad de encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación,  trabajan con la Fundación desde el año 2006,  se encuentran  en el 23° ciclo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Miriam, quien es costurera, quien tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde trabaja todos los días arduamente, siempre esta cargada de muchos pedidos y trabajo y con eso es que ayuda a su familia y esta saliendo adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos para poder cumplir con pedidos que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y cuenta que su sueño es poder agrandar su taller y dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación was set up after contact with one of the Foundation's members. They have been working with the Foundation since 2006 and are now in their 23rd cycle.

One of the group members is Miriam, she is a seamstress and has a little sewing workshop where she works hard everyday. She always has lots of orders and work and she uses this to support her family and is doing well.

She is asking for this loan to invest it by buying fabric and threads to fulfil her current orders. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives and tells us that her greatest wish is to expand her workshop and employ others.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta en su ciclo numero doce, y con mucho sacrificio y trabajo en conjunto están pudiendo salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra Florinda ella tiene su propio Kiosko , tienen 3 hijos está casada con el señor Roberto que trabaja en una empresa, todos viven en su casa de la ciudad de Encarnación.
Florinda cuenta que tiene muy buena venta y que siempre tiene muy bien surtido su negocio y que por eso le va bien, solicita de este crédito para comprar golosinas, comestibles, bebidas y demás insumos para poder seguir surtiendo su negocio.
texts.en:
This group is in its 12th cycle and with a lot of sacrifice and team work they are succeeding and helping each other.

One of the group members is Florinda, who runs her own Kiosk. She has three children and is married to Roberto who works in a business. They all live in their home in the city of Encarnación.

Florinda tells us that her products are selling well and that she always keeps her business well-stocked, so it is going well. She is asking for this loan to buy sweets, snacks, drinks and other products to be able to continue stocking her business.

loans.use: to buy sweets, snacks, drinks and other things.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
